alert.note: Alert for Southeast Suffolk; Southwest Suffolk (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued December 23 at 4:36PM EST until December 24 at 1:00AM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Up to 1 ft of inundation above ground level in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. * WHERE...Southwest Suffolk and Southeast Suffolk Counties, particularly Bellport eastward through Westhampton Beach and Quogue * WHEN...Until 1 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor coastal flooding is likely in the most vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline, with up to 1 feet of inundation above ground level in low lying, vulnerable areas. Some roads and low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns and homes/businesses with basements near the waterfront will experience shallow flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Water levels will likely exceed minor flood thresholds across eastern Great South Bay during this evening high tide in response to strong southwest winds trapping water across eastern portion of Great South Bay. This will be the final high tide of concern.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
